tournament.name: Star City Games Open Kansas City

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing landfall triggers to quickly ramp up aggressive creatures, dealing damage early and often. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Steppe Lynx and Goblin Guide, along with equipment like Sword of Body and Mind to enhance their effectiveness. The deck also includes cards like Lightning Bolt and Spikeshot Elder for removal, while Journey to Nowhere helps to deal with key threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive start and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Joraga Treespeaker and Lotus Cobra, while also utilizing cards like Overgrown Battlement and Khalni Garden for additional ramp. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana to cast a powerful Genesis Wave, which puts multiple creature and land cards into play simultaneously. This combo can quickly overwhelm the opponent with cards like Acidic Slime and Frost Titan. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card advantage and control, while Spreading Seas disrupts the opponent's mana base.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through disruption, removal, and card advantage, while gradually building up to a win condition using powerful threats like Grave Titan and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By utilizing counterspells, hand disruption, and targeted removal spells, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and take over the game with its own powerful creatures and planeswalkers. The mana base supports the control elements of the deck, allowing for consistency in casting spells and activating creature lands for additional threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with vampires, utilizing creatures like Bloodghast and Kalastria Highborn to quickly deal damage and control the board with cards like Gatekeeper of Malakir. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Burst Lightning to deal with opposing threats. The strategy involves a combination of creature damage and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Viscera Seer and Mark of Mutiny provide additional utility to the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent onslaught of aggressive vampire creatures while utilizing the tribal synergy and life-draining abilities of cards like Captivating Vampire, Kalastria Highborn, and Viscera Seer. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Disfigure and creature sacrifice effects from cards like Gatekeeper of Malakir and Bloodthrone Vampire. The inclusion of cards like Bloodghast and Marsh Flats allows for efficient graveyard recursion and mana fixing to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to slow down the opponent's strategy and control the game through mana denial and disruptive spells. By using cards like Mana Leak, Spell Pierce, and Tectonic Edge, the deck aims to counter and remove threats while also ramping up its own resources with Lotus Cobra and Explore. Additionally, the deck has powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Garruk Wildspeaker to provide card advantage and board control. Overall, the key concept revolves around controlling the pace of the game and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Lotus Cobra, and Overgrown Battlement, while controlling the board with cards like Acidic Slime and Frost Titan. The deck aims to play large threats like Primeval Titan and use Genesis Wave to put multiple permanents onto the battlefield at once. Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge can disrupt opponent's mana base, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control. The deck also includes land fetch cards like Misty Rainforest and Verdant Catacombs for consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Overgrown Battlement, Harrow, and Explore to quickly get out big threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan. The key win condition is to have Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle on the battlefield with multiple Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent's creatures or face. The deck also includes ways to search for key pieces like Khalni Heart Expedition and Khalni Garden to further enhance the ramp strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing Pyromancer Ascension to duplicate your spells and overwhelm your opponent with powerful instant and sorcery cards. By carefully managing your resources and efficiently casting spells, you can quickly activate Pyromancer Ascension and create an unstoppable combo to control the game. Key cards like Burst Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Foresee work in conjunction with Pyromancer Ascension to create a game-winning strategy. Jace, the Mind Sculptor also provides additional card advantage and control options to further strengthen your position in the game.

This deck is focused on aggressively controlling the board with cheap Vampire creatures and removal spells while draining the opponent's life total with triggered abilities and direct damage spells. By constantly pressuring the opponent with efficient threats and disrupting their game plan with removal, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize or mount a strong defense. Utilizing the synergy between Vampires and sacrifice effects, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to flood the board with aggressive red creatures and use direct damage spells to clear the way for them to attack. By consistently applying pressure and reducing the opponent's life total quickly, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or gain control. With a focus on fast, efficient creatures and burn spells, this aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victories through relentless aggression and strategic use of resources.

The deck focuses on using powerful control creatures like Frost Titan and Avenger of Zendikar, along with disruptive spells like Mana Leak and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lotus Cobra and Oracle of Mul Daya provide ramp and card advantage to keep the deck running smoothly. With a mix of land acceleration, card selection, and efficient removal spells, the deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue opponents in the long run.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of aggressive vampires, using abilities like bloodghast, captivating vampire, and Kalastria highborn to drain their life total. Supporting cards like gatekeeper of Malakir, pulse tracker, and vampire lacerator help keep up the pressure. In order to maintain card advantage and deal with threats, the deck also includes cards like lightning bolt, arc trail, and dark tutelage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with efficient lands like blackcleave cliffs and lavaclaw reaches.

This deck focuses on ramping up your land count to trigger multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle activations, dealing significant damage to your opponent's creatures and eventually their life total. By using cards like Harrow, Cultivate, and Primeval Titan, you can quickly get the necessary Mountains onto the battlefield while also putting pressure on your opponent with Avenger of Zendikar and other creature threats. With control elements like Lightning Bolt and Pyroclasm to deal with creatures, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace your opponent in the long game.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by using powerful control cards such as Mana Leak, Doom Blade, and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore, allowing it to drop big threats like Frost Titan and Grave Titan. The deck also utilizes card advantage and manipulation with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Preordain to maintain control over the game and ultimately outvalue the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells, removal spells, and land destruction cards. This allows the player to slow down the opponent's game plan while setting up their win condition with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The inclusion of cards like Grave Titan provides a strong late-game threat to finish off the opponent. This deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out in a long game, ultimately coming out on top through careful control and manipulation of the game.
